title: Daemon Tools dev releases mobile app
text:
Daemon Tools dev releases mobile app Article By: Hadlee Simons Fri, 25 Sep 2015 9:34 AM Share Your Email 
The team behind the notable Daemon Tools program for PC has finally released an app for mobile. 
Daemon Tools is a virtual drive program, allowing users to mount CD and DVD images. The program became a fixture in the PC gaming scene of yore, allowing users to run downloaded disc images. 
Now, the company has announced Daemon Sync for mobile and PC, letting users synchronise files over local WiFi. No need to rely on the cloud or a proper internet connection. 
According to Android Police, the setup is rather easy, as you install the app on your phone and the server app on your PC. 
From here, you enter a pin code to link the two together and you're ready to go. 
In addition to syncing your mobile's media (photos, videos), Daemon Sync also lets you choose PC folders to sync. Very handy. 
It's not the first time that an iconic PC app developer has released a local file-sync app, with BitTorrent Sync being released for PC and mobile as well. Read More
